programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: While driving under the influence of drugs and alcohol, Chante Mallard allegedly struck pedestrian Gregory Biggs, impaling him in the windshield; what she did and didn't do next, is what turned a terrible accident into a shocking case of murder.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Off-duty Dallas police officer Amber Guyger found Botham Jean in her apartment; the only thing more shocking than the revelations of Botham Jean's murder was the act of forgiveness at the end of the trial.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Tommy Carlton owed his ex-wife Elizabeth $85,000 in back child support; so he allegedly paid a hit man $2,000 to make her go away permanently; the hit man was an undercover cop and Elizabeth helped stage her demise.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: According to investigators, Dalia Dippolito was originally looking for African-American men to hire as a hitman to kill her husband Michael.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The sergeant on the stand testifies about "Cops" getting access to film the fake crime in the alleged murder-for-hire plot.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Police officers at a precinct in Boynton Beach, Florida became actors in a reality TV show.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: A Wife Acting in Front of Cameras
programme.desc: Jurors watch how Dalia Dippolito acts during the first of several police interviews.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: Jurors hear from the potential victim himself; days before she was arrested, Dalia got her husband to agree to take his name off the deed to their home.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.desc: The jury hears about the operation the police did to get Dalia Dippolito recorded with an undercover officer.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: 5,000 Percent Sure on the Plot to Kill
programme.desc: Seven thousand dollars was how much investigators said Dalia Dippolito agreed to pay a hitman to end her newlywed husband's life just six months of marriage.

programme.title: FL v. Dalia Dippolito
programme.sub-title: Murder Plot Exposed on Reality TV
programme.desc: The police supervisor who interviewed Dalia Dippolito had more questions to answer on the stand.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The Defense continues with character testimony of Kit Martin; they want the jury to hear a different side of the defendant which was polar opposite of the State's portrayal of him as an angry, vengeful triple murderer.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Day one of the Defense's case is all about pointing the finger at the defendant's ex-wife Joan Harmon; the jury didn't hear testimony from her because she successfully pleaded the fifth in front of this judge.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listen to more testimony from one of Kit Martin's neighbors; one says Martin was the best neighbor he and his wife ever had; the bitter divorce proceedings Martin had with his ex-wife, Joan Harmon, become evidence in his triple murder trial.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The Defense turns their attention to the physical and circumstantial evidence the State has on the defendant for the three murders; jurors' attention is brought back to the surveillance video footage which they already watched.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Getting Back Into The Cell Phone Data
programme.desc: Kit Martin's defense team isn't done quizzing the lead investigator; the Defense decides to bring in their own cell phone examiner, Jonathan Reeves; Reeves admits that he made an error in his report on this case.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listen to more testimony from the defense's expert who was refuting the allegation that cell phone data put the defendant at one of the crime scenes; it was the burning car on Rosetown road, where two of the three victims were found.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: A Blogger's Attorney Addresses the Court
programme.desc: Legal issues over an independent journalist covering Karen Read's murder trial pause court testimony; the blogger cover the case for months and is in the courtroom for trial proceedings.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors continue to bring in more members of the influential Albert family to testify in their case against Karen Read; on the stand is Nicole Albert, who was with John O'Keefe and her girlfriend Karen Read that night at a local bar.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Link Back to the Albert Family
programme.desc: In Karen Read's murder trial, jurors listen to more testimony from Nicole Albert; it is at the home Nicole shares with her husband, where John O'Keefe's unconscious body is found on the snowy front lawn.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Cross-examination continues on Nicole Albert; John O'Keefe, a veteran Boston cop, is found unconscious on her lawn during a blizzard; Nicole is asked to recollect the hours leading up to the time first responders arrived on her property.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury listens to the patriarch of the Albert family; Brian Albert is with a group of friends at a bar the night John O'Keefe is found unconscious on his snowy front lawn during a blizzard.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Details about the hours leading up to the time of O'Keefe's death are told again to jurors in Karen Read's murder trial; this time the memory recall comes from Brian Albert, the property owner where O'Keefe's body is found.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Aileen Wuornos sold her body to survive; this generated a deep-seeded rage for those who would pay for her services which allegedly resulted in the deaths of seven Florida men.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: When ex-con Scott Nelson looked at middle-aged nanny Jennifer Fulford he allegedly saw a target for his rage; Nelson had other plans when he entered the courtroom for his trial.
